item.title: Some thoughts on lowering the learning curve for using TeX
item.description: TeX has a steep learning curve. Often times, steeper than it needs to be. Take, for example, the special characters in TeX. Almost every introduction to plain TeX, eplain, LaTeX, or ConTeXt has a section on these special characters \ { } $ & # ^ _ & ~ A good introduction then goes on to explain why these special characters are important; sometimes dropping a hint about category codes.
